abstract.para: This guide describes how to get started with eXo Platform 3.5, especially for:

listitem.para: System Administrators who want to use, deploy and manage the eXo Platform system in their enterprises.
Developers who want to know how to leverage eXo Platform in their customer projects.

abstract.para: Through the guide, you can do many administrative tasks when implementing eXo Platform 3.5. The administration of eXo Platform 3.5 is categorized into the following main topics:

listitem.para: Installation and Startup: Knowledge of how to install the Tomcat bundle and JBoss EARs and information of eXo Platform profiles.

Configuration: Understanding of configuration related to eXo Platform, database, cache, users and gadget proxy, file system paths, mail server, WebDAV Cache Control, Chat Server, OpenOffice Server, Log-in, JCR.|
Management: Introduction to eXo Platform management, knowledge of eXo Platform management views.
Security: Changes related to the JAAS realm.
Backup: Backup of database and file systems for the JCR index and value storage.
Clustering: Changes related to clustering, which are necessary for eXo Platform to work in the cluster mode.
Deployment: How-Tos of removing sample applications, deploying a custom extension, setting up Apache Front-end and configuring the session timeout for the web server.
Migration: Step-by-step instructions for migrating eXo Platform from 3.0 to 3.5.
Organization Integration: Instructions on how to connect eXo Platform to a populated data source, such as LDAP server, MS ActiveDirectory, or Database.
